tachyon.master.block

Class BlockMaster

  • java.lang.Object
    • tachyon.master.MasterBase
      • tachyon.master.block.BlockMaster
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ContainerIdGenerable, JournalCheckpointStreamable, Master

    public final class BlockMaster
extends MasterBase
implements ContainerIdGenerable
    This master manages the metadata for all the blocks and block workers in Tachyon.

                         throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: Master
        Processes a journal entry and applies it to the master. These entries follow the checkpoint entries.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • start

        public void start(boolean isLeader)
           throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: Master
        Starts the master, as the leader master or the standby master. Here, the master should initialize state and possibly start threads required for operation. If isLeader is true, the master should also initialize the journal and write the checkpoint file.
        Specified by:
        start in interface Master
        Overrides:
        start in class MasterBase
        Parameters:
        isLeader - if true, the master should behave as the leader master in the system. If false, the master should act as a standby master.
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O error occurs

      • getWorkerInfoList

        public List<WorkerInfo> getWorkerInfoList()
        Returns:
        a list of WorkerInfo objects representing the workers in Tachyon. Called via RPC, and the internal web ui.

      • getCapacityBytes

        public long getCapacityBytes()
        Returns:
        the total capacity (in bytes) on all tiers, on all workers of Tachyon. Called via RPC and internal web ui.

        Returns:
        the global storage tier mapping

      • getUsedBytes

        public long getUsedBytes()
        Returns:
        the total used bytes on all tiers, on all workers of Tachyon. Called via RPC and internal web ui.

        Returns:
        a set of worker info

      • removeBlocks

        public void removeBlocks(List<Long> blockIds)
        Removes blocks from workers. Called by internal masters.
        Parameters:
        blockIds - a list of block ids to remove from Tachyon space

        public long getNewContainerId()
        Specified by:
        getNewContainerId in interface ContainerIdGenerable
        Returns:
        a new block container id. Called by internal masters

      • commitBlock

        public void commitBlock(long workerId,
                        long usedBytesOnTier,
                        String tierAlias,
                        long blockId,
                        long length)
        Marks a block as committed on a specific worker. Called by workers via RPC.
        Parameters:
        workerId - the worker id committing the block
        usedBytesOnTier - the updated used bytes on the tier of the worker
        tierAlias - the alias of the storage tier where the worker is committing the block to
        blockId - the committing block id
        length - the length of the block

      • commitBlockInUFS

        public void commitBlockInUFS(long blockId,
                             long length)
        Marks a block as committed, but without a worker location. This means the block is only in ufs. Called by internal masters.
        Parameters:
        blockId - the id of the block to commit
        length - the length of the block

      • getBlockInfo

        public BlockInfo getBlockInfo(long blockId)
                       throws BlockInfoException
        Parameters:
        blockId - the block id to get information for
        Returns:
        the BlockInfo for the given block id. Called via RPC
        Throws:
        BlockInfoException - if the block info is not found

      • getBlockInfoList

        public List<BlockInfo> getBlockInfoList(List<Long> blockIds)
        Retrieves information for the given list of block ids. Called by internal masters.
        Parameters:
        blockIds - A list of block ids to retrieve the information for
        Returns:
        A list of BlockInfo objects corresponding to the input list of block ids. The list is in the same order as the input list

      • getTotalBytesOnTiers

        public Map<String,Long> getTotalBytesOnTiers()
        Returns:
        the total bytes on each storage tier. Called by internal web ui

      • getUsedBytesOnTiers

        public Map<String,Long> getUsedBytesOnTiers()
        Returns:
        the used bytes on each storage tier. Called by internal web ui

      • getWorkerId

        public long getWorkerId(NetAddress workerNetAddress)
        Returns a worker id for the given worker. Returns the existing worker id if it exists. Called by workers, via RPC.
        Parameters:
        workerNetAddress - the worker NetAddress
        Returns:
        the worker id for this worker

      • workerRegister

        public void workerRegister(long workerId,
                           List<String> storageTiers,
                           Map<String,Long> totalBytesOnTiers,
                           Map<String,Long> usedBytesOnTiers,
                           Map<String,List<Long>> currentBlocksOnTiers)
                    throws NoWorkerException
        Updates metadata when a worker registers with the master. Called by workers via RPC.
        Parameters:
        workerId - the worker id of the worker registering
        storageTiers - a list of storage tier aliases in order of their position in the worker's hierarchy
        totalBytesOnTiers - a mapping from storage tier alias to total bytes
        usedBytesOnTiers - a mapping from storage tier alias to the used byes
        currentBlocksOnTiers - a mapping from storage tier alias to a list of blocks
        Throws:
        NoWorkerException - if workerId cannot be found

      • workerHeartbeat

        public Command workerHeartbeat(long workerId,
                               Map<String,Long> usedBytesOnTiers,
                               List<Long> removedBlockIds,
                               Map<String,List<Long>> addedBlocksOnTiers)
        Updates metadata when a worker periodically heartbeats with the master. Called by the worker periodically, via RPC.
        Parameters:
        workerId - the worker id
        usedBytesOnTiers - a mapping from tier alias to the used bytes
        removedBlockIds - a list of block ids removed from this worker
        addedBlocksOnTiers - a mapping from tier alias to the added blocks
        Returns:
        an optional command for the worker to execute

      • getLostBlocks

        public Set<Long> getLostBlocks()
        Returns:
        the lost blocks in Tachyon Storage

      • reportLostBlocks

        public void reportLostBlocks(List<Long> blockIds)
        Reports the ids of the blocks lost on workers.
        Parameters:
        blockIds - the ids of the lost blocks
